## GAD-7 vs HADS

When comparing assessment tools in psychology such as GAD-7 and HADS, a revolutionary software known as Harmony can streamline the process through its advanced AI and natural language processing capabilities. GAD-7, the Generalised Anxiety Disorder Assessment, is a seven-item tool designed to measure the severity of generalized anxiety disorder symptoms. On the other hand, the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS), is a 14-item tool used to screen for anxiety and depressive disorders. Comparing the nuances between the two, particularly GAD-7 vs HADS, can be a time-consuming task left to subjectivity. This is where Harmony shines. Harmony facilitates simplification and objectivity in the analysis of GAD-7 vs HADS. This software compares the instruments by using large language models to give a percentage match between each item. Such analytical depth provides an empirical basis for comparisons, therefore, eliminating guesswork from your research. You can easily upload the instruments onto Harmony's database or employ its drag and drop functionality for PDF itemsâ€”ensuring flexibility and ease. Critically, GAD-7 vs HADS comparison need not be language-specific, as Harmony boasts multi-language compatibility. In conclusion, the GAD-7 vs HADS evaluation has never been easier thanks to the Harmony software. This exceptional tool empowers researchers to efficiently harmonise questionnaire items, and can thus conduct longitudinal studies with enhanced accuracy and consistency. By using Harmony in the GAD-7 vs HADS study, you not only save time, but more importantly, you significantly improve the quality and cross-cultural applicability of your results, thereby advancing your research scope and impact.

* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just HADS into Harmony</a> - compare HADS with other instruments


## Questions in GAD-7

|   No. | GAD-7 English                                                                                                                                      |
|------:|:---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
|     1 | Feeling nervous, anxious, or on edge                                                                                                               |
|     2 | Not being able to stop or control worrying                                                                                                         |
|     3 | Worrying too much about different things                                                                                                           |
|     4 | Trouble relaxing                                                                                                                                   |
|     5 | Being so restless that it is hard to sit still                                                                                                     |
|     6 | Becoming easily annoyed or irritable                                                                                                               |
|     7 | Feeling afraid, as if something awful might happen                                                                                                 |
|     8 | If you checked any problems, how difficult have they made it for you to do your work, take care of things at home, or get along with other people? |
